<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Liquidity and Capital Resources</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our primary sources of
liquidity are cash provided by operations and availability under our 2002 Bank
Credit Agreement. The 2002 Bank Credit Agreement consists of a $225.0 million
Revolving Credit Facility maturing on June&nbsp;30, 2008 and a $500.0 million
Term Loan B Facility repayable in consecutive quarterly installments,
amortizing 0.25% per quarter, commencing June&nbsp;30, 2004 and continuing
through its maturity on December&nbsp;31, 2009.&#160; The applicable interest rate on the Revolving Credit Facility is
either LIBOR plus 1.25% to 2.25% or the alternative base rate plus 0.25% to
1.25% adjusted quarterly based on the ratio of total debt, net of cash, to four
quarters&#146; trailing earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and
amortization, as adjusted in accordance with the 2002 Bank Credit Agreement.&#160; The applicable interest rate on the Term
Loan B Facility is either LIBOR plus 2.25% or the alternative base rate plus
1.25%.&#160; Availability under the Revolving
Credit Facility does not reduce incrementally and terminates at maturity.&#160; We are required to prepay the Term Loan
Facility and reduce the Revolving Credit Facility with (i) 100% of the net
proceeds of any casualty loss or condemnation and; (ii) 100% of the net
proceeds of any sale or other disposition of our assets in excess of $100
million in the aggregate for any fiscal year, to the extent not used to acquire
new assets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31,
2003, we had $28.7&nbsp;million in cash balances and working capital of
approximately $15.6&nbsp;million. We anticipate that cash flow from our
operations and revolving credit facility will be sufficient to satisfy our debt
service obligations, dividend requirements, capital expenditure requirements
and operating cash needs for the next year.&#160;
As of February&nbsp;13, 2004, we had borrowed $460.9&nbsp;million under
our Term Loan&nbsp;B Facility and had not borrowed under our revolving credit
facility. The remaining balance available under the revolving credit facility
was $225.0&nbsp;million as of February&nbsp;13, 2004. Our ability to draw down
our line of credit is based on pro forma trailing cash flow levels as defined
in our 2002 Bank Credit Agreement and for the twelve months ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003, we had approximately $225.0&nbsp;million available of
current borrowing capacity under our revolving credit facility.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;19, 2002,
we filed a $350.0&nbsp;million universal shelf registration statement with the
Securities and Exchange Commission which will permit us to offer and sell
various types of securities from time to time. Offered securities may include
common stock, debt securities, preferred stock, depositary shares or any
combination thereof in amounts, prices and on terms to be announced when the
securities are offered. If we determine it is in our best interest to offer any
such securities, we intend to use the proceeds for general corporate purposes,
including, but not limited to, the reduction, redemption or refinancing of debt
or other obligations, acquisitions, capital expenditures, and working capital.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During May 2003, we
completed a private placement of $150.0 million aggregate principal amount of
4.875% Convertible Senior Subordinated Notes due 2018 (Convertible Notes).&#160; The Convertible Notes were issued at par,
mature on July&nbsp;15, 2018, and have the following characteristics:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The notes
are convertible into shares of our Class A common stock at the option of the
holder upon certain circumstances.&#160; The
conversion price is $22.37 until March&nbsp;31, 2011 at which time the
conversion price increases quarterly until reaching $28.07 on July&nbsp;15,
2018.</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The notes
may be put to us at par on January&nbsp;15, 2011, or called thereafter by us.</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The notes
bear cash interest at an annual rate of 4.875% until January&nbsp;15, 2011 and
bear cash interest at an annual rate of 2.00% from January&nbsp;15, 2011
through maturity.</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
principal amount of the notes will accrete to 125.66% of the original par
amount from January&nbsp;15, 2011 to maturity so that when combined with the
cash interest, the yield to maturity of the notes will be 4.875% per year.</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Under
certain circumstances, we will pay contingent cash interest to the holders of
the Convertible Notes during any six month period from January&nbsp;15 to
July&nbsp;14 and from July&nbsp;15 to January&nbsp;14, commencing with the six
month period beginning January&nbsp;15, 2011.&#160;
This contingent interest feature is an embedded derivative which had a
negligible fair value as of December&nbsp;31, 2003.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We used the net proceeds
from this private placement, along with the net proceeds from the issuance of
$100.0 million of 8% Senior Subordinated Notes due 2012, to finance the
redemption of the 11.625% High Yield Trust Originated Preferred Securities due
2009 (HYTOPS) to repay debt outstanding under our bank credit agreement and for
general corporate purposes.&#160; Net costs
associated with the offering totaled $4.7 million.&#160; These costs were capitalized and are being amortized as interest
expense over the term of the Convertible Notes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During May 2003, we
completed a private placement of $100.0 million aggregate principal amount of
Senior Subordinated Notes, which was an add-on issuance under the indenture
relating to our 8% Senior Subordinated Notes due 2012.&#160; The Senior Subordinated Notes were issued at
a price of $105.3359 plus accrued interest from March&nbsp;15, 2003 to May 28,
2003, yielding a rate of 7.00%.&#160; We used
the net proceeds, along with the net proceeds received in connection with our
issuance of</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">33</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='33',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the Convertible Notes, to
finance the redemption of the HYTOPS and for general corporate purposes.&#160; Net costs associated with the offering
totaled $1.4 million.&#160; These costs were
capitalized and are being amortized to interest expense over the term of the
Senior Subordinated Notes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June&nbsp;20, 2003, we
redeemed the $200.0 million aggregate principal amount of the HYTOPS, plus the
associated 4.65% call premium and accrued interest thereon.&#160; The redemption was funded through the
issuance of the 8% Senior Subordinated Notes due 2012 and the Convertible
Notes.&#160; We recognized a loss on debt
extinguishment of $15.2 million consisting of a $9.3 million call premium, a
write-off of the previous debt acquisition costs of $3.7 million and
consideration and other fees of $2.2 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The guarantors of our
registered debt securities are 100% owned by the parent and are comprised of
certain of our subsidiaries whose guarantees are full and unconditional and
joint and several. (See Note 18 in our consolidated financial statements for
the condensed consolidating financial statements of our guarantor and
non-guarantor subsidiaries.) Neither the parent nor the guarantors have any
significant restrictions on their ability to obtain funds from their
subsidiaries in the form of dividends or loans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We hold two interest rate
swap agreements that have a total notional amount of $575 million that expire
on June&nbsp;5, 2006.&#160; During
June&nbsp;2003, we assigned $200 million of the notional amount to a second
financial institution.&#160; The instrument
with a notional amount of $375 million contains a European style (that is,
exercisable only on the expiration date) termination option and can be
terminated partially or in full by the counterparty on June&nbsp;3, 2004 and
June&nbsp;3, 2005 at its fair market value.&#160;&#160;
We estimate the fair market value of the $375 million agreement at
December&nbsp;31, 2003 to be $35.1 million based on a quotation from the
counterparty and this amount is reflected as a component of other long-term
liabilities on our consolidated balance sheet as of December&nbsp;31,
2003.&#160; If the counterparty chooses to
partially or fully exercise its option to terminate the agreement, we will fund
the payment from cash generated from our operating activities and/or borrowings
under our bank credit agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The weighted average
interest rates for outstanding indebtedness relating to our Bank Credit
Agreement during 2002 and as of December&nbsp;31, 2002 were 5.14% and 4.12%, respectively.
The weighted average interest rates of our Bank Credit Agreement during 2003
and as of December&nbsp;31, 2003 were 3.64% and 3.41%, respectively.&#160; During 2003, the interest expense relating
to the Bank Credit Agreements was $18.0&nbsp;million.&#160; This trend primarily relates to a lower interest rate environment
and there can be no assurances that this trend will continue.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash flows from
operating activities decreased to $148.8&nbsp;million for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003 from $149.6&nbsp;million for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2002. We received income tax refunds net of payments of
$38.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003 as compared to
income tax refunds, net of payments of $44.1 million for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2002. Interest payments on outstanding indebtedness and
payments for subsidiary trust minority interest expense decreased $15.0
million, to $127.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003 as
compared to $142.9 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2002.&#160; The decrease in interest payments was
primarily due to the refinancing of indebtedness during November&nbsp;2002,
December&nbsp;2002, and May 2003 and the lower rates on our Bank Credit
Agreement described above.&#160; (See <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note 4 &#151;
Notes Payable and Commercial Bank Financing </font></i>in our Notes to our
Consolidated Financial Statements for more details regarding the refinancing of
our indebtedness.)&#160; Program rights
payments decreased to $105.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2003 from $106.3 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2002, or 0.8%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash flows used in
investing activities were $93.0&nbsp;million for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003 as compared to net cash flows from investing activities
of $52.8 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2002. The positive cash
flow from investing activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2002 was
primarily due to the sale of WTTV-TV broadcast assets and repayments of notes
receivable.&#160; For the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2002, we received proceeds of $124.5&nbsp;million from the
sale of WTTV-TV, $0.7&nbsp;million related to the sale of broadcast assets, and
$30.3 million for the repayment of notes receivable. During 2003, there was no
similar activity.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003, we made cash payments of $18.0&nbsp;million for the
acquisition of broadcast assets, $5.7&nbsp;million for the purchase of equity
investments, and payments for property and equipment of $69.5 million, of which
$30.9 million related to digital conversion costs and $24.1 million related to
implementation of our News Central format.&#160;
During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2002, we made equity investments
of approximately $25.8 million and we made payments for property and equipment
of $62.9 million of which $49.6 million related to digital conversion costs.&#160; We funded these acquisitions using cash
provided by operating activities and borrowings under our Revolving Credit
Facility.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">34</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='34',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For 2004, we anticipate
incurring approximately $40.0&nbsp;million of capital expenditures, of which
approximately $18.0&nbsp;million is intended to substantially complete our
digital television roll-out, $10.0&nbsp;million is for station maintenance and
equipment replacement, $8.0 million is to consolidate building and tower needs
in some markets and $4.0 million is for the addition of News Central in two
additional markets.&#160; In addition, we
anticipate that future requirements for expenditures will include expenditures
incurred during the ordinary course of business and additional strategic
station acquisitions and equity investments if suitable investments can be
identified on acceptable terms. We expect to fund such capital expenditures
with cash generated from operating activities and funding from our Revolving
Credit Facility, issuance of securities pursuant to our universal shelf-registration
statement described above or a private placement of securities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash flows used in
financing activities were $32.4 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2003 compared to net cash flows used in financing activities of $229.2 million
for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2002.&#160;
During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003, we repaid a net of $10.8
million, whereas in the comparable period in 2002, we repaid a net of $229.5
million in indebtedness.&#160; We incurred
deferred financing costs of $7.4 million related to the add-on issuance of our
8% Senior Subordinated Notes and issuance of our Convertible Notes, we redeemed
$200.0 million aggregate principal amount of the HYTOPS utilizing $209.3
million from the net issuances for the HYTOPS principal and call premium, and
we repurchased $1.5 million of our Class A common stock for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003.&#160; In comparison,
during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2002, we paid deferred financing costs
of $10.5 million.&#160; During the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2002, we received $21.8 million related to the termination of
two of our derivative instruments with no similar activity occurring during
2003.&#160; For the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002, we paid quarterly dividends of $10.4 million
on our Series D Preferred Stock.&#160; We
expect to incur these dividend payments in each of our future quarters and
expect to fund these dividends with cash generated from operating activities
and borrowings under our Bank Credit Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Income Taxes</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The income tax provision
from continuing operations increased to $15.7 million for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003, from a benefit of $4.2 million for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2002.&#160; For the year
ended December 31, 2003, our pre-tax book income from continuing operations was
$38.4 million and for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2002, our pre-tax book
loss from continuing operations was $10.1 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31,
2003, we have a net deferred tax liability of $178.2 million as compared to a
net deferred tax liability of $167.2 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2002.&#160; The increase in deferred taxes primarily
relates to deferred tax liabilities associated with book and tax differences
relating to the amortization and depreciation of intangible assets and fixed
assets, offset by deferred tax assets resulting from Federal and state net
operating losses (NOLs) generated during 2003.&#160;
Our tax rate changed to a provision in 2003 from a benefit in 2002
because we reported net income in 2003 compared to a net loss in 2002.&#160; The effective tax rate from continuing
operations decreased to 40.8% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003 from
41.0% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2002.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Seasonality/Cyclicality</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our results usually are
subject to seasonal fluctuations, which usually cause fourth quarter operating
income to be greater than first, second and third quarter operating
income.&#160; This seasonality is primarily
attributable to increased expenditures by advertisers in anticipation of
holiday season spending and an increase in viewership during this period.&#160; In addition, revenues from political
advertising and the Olympics are higher in even numbered years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Indebtedness and Other Commitments</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Indebtedness under the bank credit
agreement, as amended.</font></i>&#160;
As of December&nbsp;31, 2003, we owed $485.9 million under the bank
credit agreement, as amended, and had a $225.0 million remaining balance
available.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Indebtedness under notes.</font></i>&#160; We have issued and outstanding three series
of senior subordinated notes with aggregate principal amount issued and
outstanding of $1.1 billion.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Series D convertible exchangeable
preferred stock.</font></i>&#160; We
have issued 3,450,000 shares of series D convertible exchangeable preferred
stock with an aggregate liquidation preference of approximately $172.5 million.
The liquidation preference means we would be required to pay the holders of
series D convertible exchangeable preferred stock $172.5 million before we paid
holders of common stock (or any other stock that is junior to the series D
convertible exchangeable preferred stock) in any liquidation of Sinclair. We
are not obligated to buy back or retire the series D convertible exchangeable
preferred stock, but may do so at our option at a conversion rate of $22.8125
per share. In some circumstances, we may also exchange the series&nbsp;D convertible
exchangeable preferred stock for 6% subordinated debentures due 2012 with an
aggregate principal amount of $172.5 million.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">35</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='35',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Program contracts payable and
programming commitments.</font></i>&#160;
Total current and long-term program contracts payable at
December&nbsp;31, 2003 were $120.9 million and $92.3 million, respectively. In
addition, we enter into commitments to purchase future programming. Under these
commitments, we were obligated on December&nbsp;31, 2003 to make future
payments totaling $120.5 million.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other.</font></i>&#160; Our commitments also include capital leases,
operating leases, sports programming, personnel contracts and other
liabilities. The amount of these commitments may be material.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CONTRACTUAL CASH OBLIGATIONS, COMMERCIAL COMMITMENTS AND OFF
BALANCE SHEET ARRANGEMENTS</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have various
contractual obligations which are recorded as liabilities in our consolidated
financial statements.&#160; Other items, such
as certain purchase commitments and other executory contracts are not
recognized as liabilities in our consolidated financial statements but are
required to be disclosed.&#160; For example,
we are contractually committed to acquire future programming and make certain
minimum lease payments for the use of property under operating lease
agreements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following tables
reflect a summary of our contractual cash obligations and other commercial
commitments as of December&nbsp;31, 2003:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

 </tr>

  <td width="29%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:29.66%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">

</font></div>


<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160; </font>Only includes interest on fixed
rate debt.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160; </font>Future film liabilities reflect
a license agreement for program material that is not yet available for its
first showing or telecast.&#160; Per SFAS No.
63, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Financial
Reporting for Broadcasters</font></i>, an asset and a liability for the rights
acquired and obligations incurred under a license agreement are reported on the
balance sheet when the cost of each program is known or reasonably
determinable, the program material has been accepted by the licensee in
accordance with the conditions of the license agreement and the program is
available for its first showing or telecast.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160; </font>Commitments to contribute
capital to Allegiance Capital, LP and Sterling Ventures Partners, LP.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160; </font>We have entered into an
agreement with a third party, whereby the third party may require us to
purchase certain license and non-license broadcast assets at the option of the
third party, no earlier than July&nbsp;1, 2005.&#160; The contractual commitment for 2006 and beyond represents the
increase in purchase option price should the exercise occur in 2006 or 2007.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160; </font>Certain LMAs require us to
reimburse the licensee owner their operating costs.&#160; Certain outsourcing agreements require us to pay a fee to another
station for providing non-programming services.&#160; The amount will vary each month and, accordingly, these amounts
were estimated through the date of the agreements&#146; expiration, based on
historical cost experience.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Risk Factors</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We cannot identify nor
can we control all circumstances that could occur in the future that may
adversely affect our business and results of operations. Some of the
circumstances that may occur and may impair our business are described below.
If any of the following circumstances were to occur, our business could be
materially adversely affected.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our substantial indebtedness could
adversely affect our financial condition and prevent us from fulfilling our
debt obligations.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have a high
level of debt (totaling $1,732.5 million) compared to the book value of
shareholders&#146; equity of $229.0 million. Our relatively high level of debt poses
the following risks , particularly in periods of declining revenues:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We use a significant portion of our cash flow to
pay principal and interest on our outstanding debt and to pay dividends on
preferred stock, limiting the amount available for working capital, capital
expenditures and other general corporate purposes.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Our lenders may not be as willing to lend
additional amounts to us for future working capital needs, additional
acquisitions, or other purposes.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The interest rate under the bank credit
agreement, as amended, is a floating rate, and will increase if general
interest rates increase. This will reduce the funds available to repay our
obligations and for operations and future business opportunities, and will make
us more vulnerable to the consequences of our leveraged capital structure.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We may be more vulnerable to adverse economic
conditions than less leveraged competitors and thus less able to withstand
competitive pressures.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>If our cash flow were inadequate to make interest
and principal payments, we might have to refinance our indebtedness or sell one
or more of our stations to reduce debt service obligations.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">37</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Our ability to finance our working capital needs
and general corporate purposes for the public and private markets, as well as
the associated cost of funding is dependent, in part, by out credit
ratings.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2003,
our credit ratings, as assigned by Moody&#146;s Investor Services (Moody&#146;s) and
Standard &amp; Poor&#146;s Ratings Services (S&amp;P) are:</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
