<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The change in the
carrying amount of goodwill for the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2003
is as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="70%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:.5in;width:70.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="68%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:68.78%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Balance
  as of January&nbsp;1, 2003</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.92%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.9%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="24%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:24.1%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,123,403</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="68%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:68.78%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Reversal
  of prior year acquisitions&#146; tax contingencies and other</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.92%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="26%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:26.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4,869</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="68%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:68.78%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Balance
  as of December&nbsp;31, 2003</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.92%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.9%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="24%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:24.1%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,118,534</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2003, tax
contingencies recorded in connection with the purchase accounting for prior
year acquisitions were reversed because those contingencies were either settled
or eliminated.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">4.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>NOTES PAYABLE AND
COMMERCIAL BANK FINANCING:</u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">1998 Bank Credit Agreement</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May 16, 2001, we
closed on an amendment and restatement of the 1998 Bank Credit Agreement (the
Amended and Restated Bank Credit Agreement) allowing us more operating capacity
and liquidity.&#160; The Amended and Restated
Bank Credit Agreement reduced the aggregate borrowing capacity from $1.6
billion to $1.1 billion.&#160; We repaid the
unamortized outstanding balance of the $750.0 million Term Loan Facility with
the proceeds from the Amended and Restated Bank Credit Agreement.&#160; The Amended and Restated Bank Credit
Agreement consisted of a $600 million Revolving Credit Facility and a $500
million Incremental Term Loan Facility repayable in consecutive quarterly
installments amortizing 1% per year commencing March&nbsp;31, 2003 and
continuing through its maturity on September&nbsp;30, 2009.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The applicable interest
rate for the Revolving Credit Facility was either LIBOR plus 1.25% to 3% or the
alternative base rate plus zero to 1.75%.&#160;
The applicable interest rate for the Revolving Credit Facility was
adjusted based on the ratio of total debt</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-17</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-17',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">to four quarters&#146;
trailing earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization. The
applicable interest rate on the Incremental Term Loan Facility was LIBOR plus
3.50% or the alternative base rate plus 2.25% through maturity.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of amending
our 1998 Bank Credit Agreement, we incurred debt acquisition costs of $8.5
million and recognized a loss of $4.7 million, net of a tax benefit of $2.6
million.&#160; The loss represents the
write-off of certain debt acquisition costs associated with indebtedness
replaced by the new facility. The loss was computed based on the guidance of
EITF No. 96-19 <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Debtor&#146;s Accounting for a Modification or Exchange of Debt Instrument</font></i>
and EITF No. 98-14 <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Debtor&#146;s Accounting for changes in Line of Credit or
Revolving Debt Arrangements.</font></i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October&nbsp;30, 2001,
we closed on a short-term amendment of our 1998 Bank Credit Agreement, as
amended and restated in May 2001.&#160; The
amendment, which was effective through September&nbsp;30, 2002, provided for
relaxed leverage and interest coverage ratios and increased the interest rate
by 50 basis points during the amendment period.&#160; As a result of the amendment, our interest rate on the Revolving
Credit Facility and Incremental Term Loan Facility was LIBOR plus 3.5% and
LIBOR plus 4.00%, respectively.&#160; We
incurred $3.4 million of debt acquisition costs as a result of amending our
1998 Bank Credit Agreement.&#160; These costs
were capitalized in accordance with EITF No. 96-19 and EITF No. 98-14 and were
amortized to interest expense over the remaining life of the debt.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The weighted average
interest rates for outstanding indebtedness relating to the Amended and
Restated Bank Credit Agreement during 2001 and as of December&nbsp;31, 2001
were 6.57% and 5.85%, respectively.&#160;
Interest expense relating to the 1998 Bank Credit Agreement was $61.1
million for year ended December&nbsp;31, 2001.&#160;
The 1998 Bank Credit Agreement was paid off on July&nbsp;15, 2002 with
the proceeds from the 2002 Bank Credit Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">2002 Bank Credit Agreement</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July&nbsp;15, 2002, we
closed on a new Bank Credit Agreement (the 2002 Bank Credit Agreement),
allowing us more operating capacity and liquidity.&#160; The proceeds of the 2002 Bank Credit Agreement were used to pay
off the 1998 Bank Credit Agreement.&#160; The
2002 Bank Credit Agreement consists of a $225.0 million Revolving Credit
Facility maturing on June&nbsp;30, 2008 and a $375.0 million Term Loan B
Facility repayable in consecutive quarterly installments, amortizing 0.25% per
quarter, commencing June&nbsp;30, 2004 and continuing through its maturity on
December&nbsp;31, 2009.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31,
2003, no amounts were outstanding under the Revolving Credit Facility.&#160; Additionally, we are required to pay a 0.5%
annual commitment fee on the unused credit facility.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The applicable interest
rate on the Revolving Credit Facility is either LIBOR plus 1.25% to 2.25% or
the alternative base rate plus 0.25% to 1.25% adjusted quarterly based on the
ratio of total debt, net of cash, to four quarters&#146; trailing earnings before
interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization, as adjusted in accordance with
the 2002 Bank Credit Agreement.&#160; The
applicable interest rate on the Term Loan B Facility is either LIBOR plus 2.25%
or the alternative base rate plus 1.25%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Availability under the
Revolving Credit Facility does not reduce incrementally and terminates at
maturity.&#160; We are required to prepay the
Term Loan Facility and reduce the Revolving Credit Facility with (i) 100% of
the net proceeds of any casualty loss or condemnation and; (ii) 100% of the net
proceeds of any sale or other disposition of our assets in excess of $100
million in the aggregate for any fiscal year, to the extent not used to acquire
new assets.&#160; The 2002 Bank Credit
Agreement contains representations and warranties, and affirmative and negative
covenants, including among other restrictions, limitations on additional
indebtedness, customary for credit facilities of this type.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of closing on
the 2002 Bank Credit Agreement, we incurred debt acquisition costs of $3.2
million and recognized a loss of $4.2 million, net of tax benefit of $2.4
million.&#160; The loss represents the
write-off of certain debt acquisition costs associated with indebtedness
replaced by the new facility.&#160; The loss
was computed based on the guidance of EITF No. 96-19 <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Debtor&#146;s Accounting for a Modification
of Exchange of Debt Instrument</font></i> and EITF No. 98-14<i><font style="font-style:italic;"> Debtor&#146;s
Accounting for changes in Line of Credit or Revolving Debt Arrangements.</font></i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;31, 2002
we closed on an additional $125 million Term Loan Facility repayable in
consecutive quarterly installments, amortizing 0.25% per quarter, commencing
June&nbsp;30, 2004 continuing through its maturity on December&nbsp;31,
2009.&#160; The proceeds from this additional
borrowing, together with $125 million added on to our $300 million 8% Senior
Subordinated Notes due 2012 and cash on hand was used to redeem our 8.75%
Senior Subordinated Notes due 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The weighted average
interest rates of the 2002 Bank Credit Agreement during 2003 and as of
December&nbsp;31, 2003 were 3.64% and 3.41%, respectively.&#160; During 2003 and 2002, the interest expense
relating to the Bank Credit Agreements was $18.0 million and $27.9 million,
respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-18</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-18',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">8.75% Senior Subordinated Notes Due 2007 and 2002 Tender
Offer</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;1997, we
completed an issuance of $250 million aggregate principal amount of 8.75%
Senior Subordinated Notes due 2007 (8.75% Notes) pursuant to a shelf
registration statement and we received net proceeds of $242.8 million.&#160; Of the net proceeds from the issuance,
$106.2 million was utilized to tender our 1993 Notes with the remainder
retained for general corporate purposes.&#160;
Interest on the 8.75% Notes was payable semiannually on June&nbsp;15 and
December&nbsp;15 of each year.&#160; Interest
expense was $20.2 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2002 and $21.9
million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2001.&#160; The 8.75% Notes were issued under an Indenture among us, our
subsidiaries (the guarantors) and the trustee.&#160;
Costs associated with the offering totaled $5.8 million, including an
underwriting discount of $5.0 million.&#160;
These costs were capitalized and were being amortized over the life of
the debt.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
December&nbsp;2002, we completed a tender offer of $213.0 million aggregate
principal amount of the 8.75% Notes (2002 Tender Offer).&#160; Total consideration per $1,000 principal
amount note tendered was $1,043.74 resulting in total consideration paid to
consummate the Tender Offer of $223.2 million.&#160;
Also in December&nbsp;2002, we redeemed the remaining 8.75% Notes for
total consideration of $39.0 million.&#160;
The Tender Offer and redemption were funded through the issuance of a
$125 million add-on to our existing 8.0% $300 million Senior Subordinated Notes
due 2012, a $125 million additional funding on our Term Loan B Facility, a draw
down on our revolving line of credit of $7.0 million and cash on hand for a
total consideration paid of $262.2 million.&#160;
We recognized a loss of $2.5 million, net of tax benefit of $1.4
million, representing a write-off of the previous debt acquisition costs of
$3.2 million and consideration of $0.7 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">9% Senior Subordinated Notes Due 2007</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July&nbsp;1997, we
completed an issuance of $200 million aggregate principal amount of 9% Senior
Subordinated Notes due 2007 (9% Notes).&#160;
We utilized $162.5 million of the approximately $195.6 million net
proceeds of the issuance to repay outstanding revolving credit indebtedness and
utilized the remainder to fund acquisitions.&#160;
Interest on the 9% Notes was payable semiannually on January&nbsp;15 and
July&nbsp;15 of each year, commencing January&nbsp;15, 1998.&#160; Interest expense was $16.2 million and $18.0
million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2002 and 2001, respectively.&#160; The 9% Notes were issued under an Indenture
among us, our subsidiaries (the guarantors) and the trustee.&#160; Costs associated with the offering totaled
$4.8 million, including an underwriting discount of $4.0 million.&#160; These costs were capitalized and were being
amortized over the life of the debt.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On November&nbsp;8, 2002
the 9% Notes were redeemed for an aggregate principal amount of $200 million.&#160; The redemption occurred through the issuance
of a $125 million add-on to our 8% $300 million Senior Subordinated Notes due
2012 and available cash on hand for total consideration of $218.5 million
including accrued interest of $7.2 million.&#160;
We recognized a loss of $2.4 million, net of deferred taxes of $1.3
million, representing a write-off of the previous debt acquisition costs of
$2.3 million and consideration of $1.4 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">10% Senior Subordinated Notes Due 2005</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In August&nbsp;1995, we
completed an issuance of $300 million aggregate principal amount of 10% Senior
Subordinated Notes (the &#147;1995 Notes&#148;), due 2005.&#160; We received net proceeds of $293.2 million.&#160; The net proceeds of this offering were
utilized to repay outstanding indebtedness under the then existing Bank Credit
Agreement of $201.8 million with the remainder being retained and eventually
utilized to make payments related to certain acquisitions consummated during
1996.&#160; Interest on the 1995 Notes was
payable semiannually on March&nbsp;30 and September&nbsp;30 of each year.&#160; Interest expense was $28.3 million for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2001.&#160; The
1995 Notes were issued under an indenture among us, our subsidiaries (the
guarantors) and the trustee.&#160; Costs
associated with the offering totaled $6.8 million, including an underwriting
discount of $6.0 million.&#160; These costs
were capitalized and were being amortized over the life of the debt.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2001, we
redeemed the $300 million aggregate principal amount of the 1995 Notes for a
total consideration of $318.3 million, including accrued interest of $6.1
million.&#160; We recognized a loss of $9.5
million, net of a tax benefit of $5.2 million.&#160;
The loss represented a write-off of the previous debt acquisition costs
of $2.5 million and consideration of $12.2 million.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-19</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-19',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">8.75% Senior Subordinated Notes Due 2011</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2001, we
completed an issuance of $310 million aggregate principal amount of 8.75%
Senior Subordinated Notes (the 2001 Notes), due 2011.&#160; We received net proceeds of $306.2 million.&#160; The net proceeds of this offering were
utilized to repay the 1995 Notes.&#160;
Interest on the 2001 Notes is payable semiannually on June&nbsp;15<sup>th</sup>
and December&nbsp;15<sup>th</sup> of each year.&#160; Interest expense was $27.0 million for each of the years ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002.&#160; The
2001 Notes were issued under an indenture among us, our subsidiaries (the
guarantors) and the trustee.&#160; Costs
associated with the offering totaled $4.1 million, including an underwriting
discount of $3.8 million.&#160; These costs
were capitalized and are being amortized over the life of the debt.&#160; Based on the quoted market price, the fair
value of the 2001 Notes as of December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002 was $331.9
million and $335.1 million, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">8% Senior Subordinated Notes Due 2012</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In March&nbsp;2002, we
completed an issuance of $300.0 million aggregate principal amount of 8% Senior
Subordinated Notes (the 2002 Notes), due 2012, generating gross proceeds to us
of $300.0 million.&#160; The gross proceeds of
this offering were utilized to repay $300.0 million of the Term Loan
Facility.&#160; We recognized a loss of $0.7
million, net of a tax benefit of $0.4 million.&#160;
The loss represented the write-off of certain debt acquisition costs
associated with indebtedness replaced by the 2002 Notes.&#160; Interest on the 2002 Notes is payable
semiannually on March&nbsp;15 and September&nbsp;15 of each year, beginning
September&nbsp;15, 2002.&#160; Interest
expense was $23.9 million and $19.2 million for the years ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002, respectively.&#160;
The 2002 Notes were issued under an indenture among us, certain of our
subsidiaries (the guarantors) and the trustee.&#160;
Net costs associated with the offering totaled $3.4 million.&#160; These costs were capitalized and are being
amortized to interest expense over the term of the 2002 Notes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On November&nbsp;8, 2002,
we completed an issuance of $125.0 million aggregate principal amount of 8%
Senior Subordinated Notes due 2012 at a price of 100.5% of par, plus accrued
interest from September&nbsp;15, 2002 to November&nbsp;7, 2002.&#160; Interest expense was $10.0 million and $1.4
million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002, respectively.&#160; After deducting discount and commission and
estimated expenses of the offering of $1.9 million, we received approximately
$125.8 million from the sale of the notes.&#160;
We used the net proceeds together with available cash on hand and a draw
down of $10.0 million on the revolving line of credit under the 2002 Bank
Credit Agreement, to redeem our existing 9% Senior Subordinated Notes including
an early redemption premium of $9.0 million and accrued interest of $7.2
million.&#160; Net costs associated with the
offering totaled $1.6 million.&#160; These
costs were capitalized and are being amortized to interest expense over the
term of the 2002 notes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;31,
2002, we completed an add-on issuance of $125.0 million aggregate principle
amount of 8% Senior Subordinated Notes due 2012 at a premium of $3.8
million.&#160; Interest expense was $10.0
million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003.&#160; We received net proceeds of approximately $130.4 million from the
sale of the notes.&#160; We used the net
proceeds together with additional funding from our term loan of $125 million, a
draw down of $7.0 million on the revolving line of credit under the 2002 Bank
Credit Agreement and available cash on hand of $0.2 million, to redeem our
existing 8.75% Senior Subordinated Notes due 2007, including an early
redemption premium of $10.9 million.&#160;
Net costs associated with the offering totaled $1.7 million.&#160; Of these costs, $1.3 million were
capitalized and are being amortized to interest expense over the term of the
2002 notes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May 29, 2003, we
completed an add-on issuance of $100.0 million aggregate principal amount of 8%
Senior Subordinated Notes, which was an add-on issuance under the indenture
relating to our 8% Senior Subordinated Notes due 2012.&#160; Interest expense for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003 was $4.7 million.&#160;
The Notes were issued at a price of $105.3359 plus accrued interest from
March&nbsp;15, 2003 to May 28, 2003, yielding a rate of 7.00%.&#160; We used the net proceeds, along with the net
proceeds received in connection with our issuance of $150.0 million of
Convertible Senior Subordinated Notes due 2018, to finance the redemption of
the 11.625% High Yield Trust Originated Preferred Securities due 2009 and for
general corporate purposes.&#160; Net costs
associated with the offering totaled $1.3 million.&#160; These costs were capitalized and are being amortized to interest
expense over the term of the Senior Subordinated Notes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based on the quoted
market price, the fair market value of the 8% Senior Subordinated Notes due
2012 was $671.3 million at December&nbsp;31, 2003 and $572.2 million at
December&nbsp;31, 2002.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">4.875% Convertible Senior Subordinated
Notes Due 2012</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During May 2003, we
completed a private placement of $150.0 million aggregate principal amount of
4.875% Convertible Senior Subordinated Notes due 2018 (Convertible Notes).&#160; The Convertible Notes were issued at par, mature
on July&nbsp;15, 2018, and have the following characteristics:</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-20</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-20',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The notes
are convertible into shares of our class A common stock at the option of the
holder upon certain circumstances.&#160; The
conversion price is $22.37 until March&nbsp;31, 2011 at which time the
conversion price increases quarterly until reaching $28.07 on July&nbsp;15,
2018.</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The notes
may be put to us at par on January&nbsp;15, 2011 or called thereafter by us.</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The notes
bear cash interest at an annual rate of 4.875% until January&nbsp;15, 2011 and
bear cash interest at an annual rate of 2.00% from January&nbsp;15, 2011
through maturity.&#160; Interest expense was
$4.5 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003.</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
principal amount of the notes will accrete to 125.66% of the original par
amount from January&nbsp;15, 2011 to maturity so that when combined with the
cash interest, the yield to maturity of the notes will be 4.875% per year.</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Under
certain circumstances, we will pay contingent cash interest to the holders of
the Convertible Notes during any six month period from January&nbsp;15 to
July&nbsp;14 and from July&nbsp;15 to January&nbsp;14, commencing with the six
month period beginning January&nbsp;15, 2011.&#160;
This contingent interest feature is an embedded derivative which had a
negligible fair value as of December&nbsp;31, 2003.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We used the net proceeds,
along with the net proceeds from the issuance on May 29, 2003 of $100.0 million
of 8% Senior Subordinated Notes due 2012, to finance the redemption of the
11.625% High Yield Trust Originated Preferred Securities due 2009, to repay
debt outstanding under our bank credit agreement and for general corporate
purposes.&#160; Net costs associated with the
offering totaled $4.6 million.&#160; These
costs were capitalized and are being amortized as interest expense over the
term of the Convertible Notes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based on the quoted
market price, the fair market value of the 4.875% Convertible Senior
Subordinated Notes Due 2012 was $162.2 million at December&nbsp;31, 2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Summary</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes payable, capital
leases, and the 2002 Bank Credit Agreement consisted of the following as of
December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002 (in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

 <tr>
  <td width="68%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:68.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.875%
  Convertible Senior Subordinated Notes due 2012</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.18%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.08%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">150,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.18%;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-21</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Substantially all of our
stock in our wholly owned subsidiaries has been pledged as security for notes
payable and commercial bank financing.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31,
2003, we had 26 capital leases with non-affiliates including 24 tower leases,
one building lease and a computer hardware lease.&#160; All of our tower leases will expire within the next 30 years, the
building leases will expire within the next 12 years and our computer hardware
lease will expire within the next year.&#160;
Most of our leases have a 5-10 year renewal option and it is expected
that these leases will be renewed or replaced within the normal course of
business.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">5.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>PROGRAM CONTRACTS
PAYABLE:</u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Future payments required
under program contracts payable as of December&nbsp;31, 2003 were as follows
(in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="75%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:75.68%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Less:&#160; Current portion</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.74%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="75%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:75.68%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Long-term
  portion of program contracts payable</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.74%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.78%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="17%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:17.1%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">92,299</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Included in the current
portion amounts are payments due in arrears of $27.4 million.&#160; In addition, we have entered into
non-cancelable commitments for future program rights aggregating $120.5 million
as of December&nbsp;31, 2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We perform a net
realizable value calculation for each of our non-cancelable commitments in
accordance with SFAS No. 63, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Financial Reporting by Broadcasters</font></i>.&#160; We utilize sales information to estimate the
future revenue of each commitment and measure that amount against the amount of
the commitment.&#160; If the estimated future
revenue is less than the amount of the commitment, a loss is recorded.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have estimated the
fair value of our program contract payables and non-cancelable commitments at
approximately $204.9 million and $108.8 million, respectively, as of
December&nbsp;31, 2003, and $233.6 million and $53.6 million, respectively, as
of December&nbsp;31, 2002.&#160; These
estimates were based on future cash payments discounted at our current
borrowing rate.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">6.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>COMPANY
OBLIGATED MANDATORILY REDEEMABLE PREFERRED SECURITIES OF SUBSIDIARY TRUST,
COMMON STOCK AND PREFERRED STOCK:</u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">1997 Offering of Company Obligated Mandatorily Redeemable
Preferred Securities of Subsidiary Trust</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In March&nbsp;1997, we
completed a private placement of $200 million aggregate liquidation value of
11.625% High Yield Trust Offered Preferred Securities (HYTOPS) of our
subsidiary trust, Sinclair Capital.&#160; The
HYTOPS were issued March&nbsp;12, 1997, mature March&nbsp;15, 2009, and
provided for quarterly distributions to be paid in arrears beginning
June&nbsp;15, 1997.&#160; The HYTOPS were
sold to &#147;qualified institutional buyers&#148; (as defined in Rule 144A under the
Securities Act of 1933, as amended) and a</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-22</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-22',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">limited number of
institutional &#147;accredited investors&#148; and the offering was exempt from
registration under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the Securities Act),
pursuant to Section&nbsp;4(2) of the Securities Act and Rule 144A
thereunder.&#160; We utilized $135.0 million
of the approximately $192.8 million net proceeds of the private placement to
repay outstanding debt and retained the remainder for general corporate
purposes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to a
Registration Rights Agreement entered into in connection with the private
placement of the HYTOPS, we offered holders of the HYTOPS the right to exchange
the HYTOPS for new HYTOPS having the same terms as the existing securities,
except that the exchange of the new HYTOPS for the existing HYTOPS has been
registered under the Securities Act.&#160; On
May 2, 1997, we filed a registration statement on Form S-4 with the Commission
for the purpose of registering the new HYTOPS to be offered in exchange for our
aforementioned existing HYTOPS issued in March&nbsp;1997 (the &#147;Exchange
Offer&#148;).&#160; Our Exchange Offer was closed
and became effective August&nbsp;11, 1997, at which time all of the existing
HYTOPS were exchanged for new HYTOPS. Annual preferred dividends, payable to
the holders of HYTOPS, are recorded as &#147;Subsidiary trust minority interest
expense&#148; in the accompanying financial statements and were $11.0 million, $23.3
million, and $23.3 million for the three years ended December&nbsp;31, 2003,
2002, and 2001.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June&nbsp;20, 2003, we
redeemed the $200.0 million aggregate principal amount of the 11.625%
HYTOPS.&#160; The redemption occurred through
the issuance on May 29, 2003 of the 8% Senior Subordinated Notes due 2012 and
the Convertible Notes.&#160; We recognized a
loss on debt extinguishment of $15.2 million consisting of a $9.3 million call
premium, a write-off of the previous deferred financing costs of $3.7 million
and other fees of $2.2 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Common Stock</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Holders of Class A Common
Stock are entitled to one vote per share and holders of Class B Common Stock
are entitled to ten votes per share except for votes relating to &#147;going
private&#148; and certain other transactions. The Class A Common Stock and the Class
B Common Stock vote altogether as a single Class except as otherwise may be
required by Maryland law on all matters presented for a vote. Holders of Class
B Common Stock may at any time convert their shares into the same number of
shares of Class A Common Stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Preferred Stock</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 1997, we completed
a public offering of 3,450,000 shares of Series D Convertible Exchangeable
Preferred Stock (the &#147;1997 Preferred Stock Offering&#148;). The Convertible
Exchangeable Preferred Stock has a liquidation preference of $50 per share and
a stated annual cumulative dividend of $3.00 per share payable quarterly out of
legally available funds and are convertible into shares of Class A Common Stock
at the option of the holders thereof at a conversion price of $22.813 per
share, subject to adjustment.&#160; The
Convertible Exchangeable Preferred Stock is convertible into 7,561,644 shares
of Class A common stock, all of which we have reserved for future
issuance.&#160; The shares of Convertible
Exchangeable Preferred Stock are exchangeable at our option, for 6% Convertible
Subordinated Debentures, due 2012, and are redeemable at our option on or after
September&nbsp;20, 2000 at specified prices plus accrued dividends.&#160; Holders of Convertible Exchangeable
Preferred Stock do not have any voting rights in ordinary circumstances.&#160; In exercising any voting rights, each
outstanding share of Series D Convertible Exchangeable Preferred Stock will be
entitled to one vote.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">7.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>DERIVATIVE
INSTRUMENTS:</u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We enter into derivative
instruments primarily for the purpose of reducing the impact of changing
interest rates on our floating rate debt and to reduce the impact of changing
fair market values of our fixed rate debt.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Statement of Financial Accounting Standard No. 133</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On January&nbsp;1, 2001,
we adopted SFAS No. 133, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for Derivative Instruments and Hedging </font></i>Activities,
SFAS No. 137, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities &#150;Deferral
of the Effective Date of SFAS 133</font></i> and SFAS No. 138, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting
for Certain Derivative Instruments and Certain Hedging Activities</font></i>,
an amendment of FASB Statement No. 133. SFAS No. 133, as amended, establishes
accounting and reporting standards requiring that every derivative instrument
be recorded in the balance sheet as either an asset or liability measured at
its fair value. SFAS No. 133 requires that changes in the derivative
instrument&#146;s fair value be recognized currently in earnings unless specific
hedge accounting criteria are met. Special accounting for qualifying hedges
allows a derivative instrument&#146;s gains and losses to offset related results on
the hedged item in the income statement, to the extent effective, and requires
that a company must formally document, designate, and assess the effectiveness
of transactions that receive hedge accounting. SFAS No. 133 had the following
impact on our financial statements.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-23</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-23',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our losses resulting from
prior year terminations of fixed to floating interest rate agreements are
reflected as a discount on our fixed rate debt and are being amortized to
interest expense through December&nbsp;15, 2007, the expiration date of the
terminated swap agreements.&#160; For each of
the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001, amortization of $0.5
million of the discount was recorded as interest expense for each respective
period.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We experienced deferred
net losses in prior years related to terminations of floating to fixed interest
rate swap agreements.&#160; These deferred
net losses are reflected as other comprehensive loss, net of tax effect, and
are being amortized to interest expense through June&nbsp;3, 2004, the
expiration dates of the terminated swap agreements.&#160; For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001, we amortized
$1.7 million, $1.3 million and $0.3 million, respectively, from accumulated
other comprehensive loss and deferred tax asset to interest expense.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Interest Rate Derivative Instruments</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the twelve months
ended December&nbsp;31, 2003, we held the following derivative instruments:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>An
interest rate swap agreement with a financial institution that has a notional
amount of $575 million, which expires of June&nbsp;5, 2006.&#160; During June&nbsp;2003, we assigned $200
million of the notional amount to a second financial institution.&#160; Both agreements expire on June&nbsp;5,
2006.&#160; These swap agreements require us
to pay a fixed rate, which is set in the range of 6.25% to 7.00% and receive a
floating rate based on the three month London Interbank Offered Rate (LIBOR)
(measurement and settlement is performed quarterly).&#160; These swap agreements are reflected as a derivative obligation
based on their fair value of $54.1 million and $71.5 million as a component of
other long-term liabilities in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets as
of December&nbsp;31, 2003 and December&nbsp;31, 2002, respectively.&#160; These swap agreements do not qualify for
hedge accounting treatment under SFAS No. 133; therefore, changes in their fair
market values are reflected currently in earnings as gain (loss) on derivative
instruments.&#160; We incurred an unrealized
gain of $17.4 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003 and an
unrealized loss of $30.9 million and $34.4 million during the years ended
December&nbsp;31, 2002 and 2001, respectively, related to these instruments.&#160; The instrument with a notional amount of
$375 million contains a European style (that is, exercisable only on the
expiration date) termination option and can be terminated partially or in full
by the counterparty on June&nbsp;3, 2004 and June&nbsp;3, 2005 at its fair
market value.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>In
March&nbsp;2002, we entered into two interest rate swap agreements with
notional amounts totaling $300 million which expire on March&nbsp;15, 2012 in
which we receive a fixed rate of 8% and pay a floating rate based on LIBOR
(measurement and settlement is performed quarterly).&#160; These swaps are accounted for as a hedge of our 8% debenture in
accordance with SFAS No. 133 whereby changes in the fair market value of the
swaps are reflected as adjustments to the carrying amount of the debenture.&#160; These swaps are reflected in the
accompanying balance sheet as a derivative asset and as a premium on the 8%
debenture based on their fair value of $18.6 million.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>In
November&nbsp;2003, we entered into two interest rate swap agreements with
notional amounts totaling $100 million, which expire March&nbsp;15, 2012, in
which we receive a fixed rate of 8% and pay a floating rate based on LIBOR
(measurement and settlement is performed quarterly).&#160; These swaps are accounted for as a hedge of our 8% Senior Subordinated
Notes in accordance with SFAS No. 133, whereby changes in the fair market value
of the swaps are reflected as adjustments to the carrying amount of the Senior
Subordinated Notes.&#160; These swaps are
reflected on the accompanying balance sheet as a derivative asset and as a
premium on the 8% debenture based on their fair value of $0.3 million.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The counterparties to
these agreements are international financial institutions. We estimate the net
fair value of these instruments at December&nbsp;31, 2003 to be a liability of
$35.2 million.&#160; The fair value of the
interest rate swap agreements is estimated by obtaining quotations from the
financial institutions, which are a party to our derivative contracts. The fair
value is an estimate of the net amount that we would pay on December&nbsp;31,
2003 if we cancelled the contracts or transferred them to other parties.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June&nbsp;2001, we
entered into an interest rate swap agreement with a notional amount of $250
million which expires on December&nbsp;15, 2007 in which we received a fixed
rate of 8.75% and paid a floating rate based on LIBOR (measurement and
settlement is performed quarterly).&#160;
This swap was accounted for as a hedge of our 8.75% debenture in
accordance with SFAS No. 133 whereby changes in the fair market value of the
swap were reflected as adjustments to the carrying amount of the
debenture.&#160; During December&nbsp;2002,
we terminated this interest rate swap agreement.&#160; We received $10.9 million upon termination, which offset the
premium that we paid on the 8.75% notes redemption.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-24</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-24',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June&nbsp;2001, we
entered into an interest rate swap agreement with a notional amount of $200
million which expires on July&nbsp;15, 2007 in which we received a fixed rate
of 9% and paid a floating rate based on LIBOR (measurement and settlement is
performed quarterly).&#160; This swap was
accounted for as a hedge of our 9% Notes in accordance with SFAS No. 133
whereby changes in the fair market value of the swap were reflected as
adjustments to the carrying amount of the debenture.&#160; During November&nbsp;2002, we terminated this interest rate swap
agreement and received $9.0 million, which offset the premium that we paid on
the 9% notes redemption.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During May 2003, we
completed an issuance of $150.0 million aggregate principal amount of 4.875%
Convertible Senior Subordinated Bonds.&#160;
See <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note</font></i>
<i><font style="font-style:italic;">4 &#150; Notes
Payable and Commercial Bank Financing</font></i>.&#160; Under certain circumstances, we will pay contingent cash interest
to the holder of the convertible notes during any six month period from
January&nbsp;15 to July&nbsp;14 and from July&nbsp;15 to January&nbsp;14,
commencing with the six month period beginning January&nbsp;15, 2011.&#160; The contingent interest feature is an
embedded derivative which had a negligible fair value as of December&nbsp;31,
2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">8.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>INCOME TAXES:</u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We file a consolidated
federal income tax return and separate company state tax returns.&#160; The provision (benefit) for the income taxes
consisted of the following for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and
2001 (in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.4%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(26,023</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 1.45pt 0in;width:2.12%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.4%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(59,482</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 1.45pt 0in;width:1.06%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following is a
reconciliation of federal income taxes at the applicable statutory rate to the
recorded provision (benefit) from continuing operations:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:3.54%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.46%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:3.16%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.66%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:3.1%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="54%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:54.24%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Provision
  (benefit) for income taxes</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.1%;">

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">40.8</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:3.54%;">

  </td>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(41.0</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)%</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 1.45pt 0in;width:3.1%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Temporary differences
between the financial reporting carrying amounts and the tax basis of assets
and liabilities give rise to deferred taxes.&#160;
We had a net deferred tax liability of $178.2 million and $167.2 million
as of December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-25</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-25',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our remaining federal and
state net operating losses will expire during various years from 2004 to 2023,
and in certain cases, are subject to annual limitations under Internal Revenue
Code Section&nbsp;382 and similar state provisions.&#160; The tax effects of these net operating losses are recorded in the
deferred tax accounts in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

and deferred tax liabilities as of December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002 were as
follows (in thousands):</font></p>

  </td>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">46,972</font></p>
