  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(167,208</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 1.45pt 0in;width:1.08%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We establish valuation
allowances in accordance with the provisions of SFAS No. 109, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting
for Income Taxes</font></i>.&#160; A
valuation allowance has been provided for deferred tax assets relating to
various federal and state net operating loss (NOL) carryforwards.&#160; The realization of deferred tax assets
associated with federal and state NOL carryforwards is dependent upon
generating sufficient taxable income prior to their expiration.&#160; Management believes that there is a risk
that certain of these federal and state NOL carryforwards may expire unused and
accordingly, has established a valuation allowance against them.&#160; The valuation allowance increased $10.8
million in 2003, principally related to acquired NOLs.&#160; Although realization is not assured for the
remaining deferred tax assets, management believes it is more likely than not
that they will be realized through future taxable earnings or alternative tax
strategies.&#160; We periodically review the
adequacy of the valuation allowance and make any necessary adjustments to the
extent that management&#146;s estimates of taxable income during the carryforward
period significantly change.&#160; Any
subsequent changes to the valuation allowance will be reported in accordance
with SFAS No. 109.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the third and fourth
quarter 2003, the statute of limitations expired for certain tax returns
related to discontinued operations in 1999.&#160;
As a result, our 2003 benefit for income taxes &#150; discontinued operations
reflects $1.6 million reduction of taxes provided in prior periods.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2001,
the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) completed its examination of our federal
income tax returns filed through 1997.&#160;
As a result of this settlement, our 2001 benefit for income taxes
reflects $6.3 million reduction of taxes provided in prior periods.&#160; The IRS has initiated an examination of
federal tax returns subsequent to 1998.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management periodically
performs a comprehensive review of our tax positions and accrues amounts for
tax contingencies.&#160; Based on these
reviews, the status of ongoing audits and the expiration of applicable statute
of limitations, accruals are adjusted as necessary. The resolution of audits is
unpredictable and could result in tax liabilities that are significantly higher
or lower than that which has been provided by us.&#160; Amounts accrued for these tax matters are included in long-term
liabilities in our consolidated balance sheet.&#160;
We believe that adequate accruals have been provided for all years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">9.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>COMMITMENTS AND
CONTINGENCIES</u>:</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Litigation</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Lawsuits and claims are
filed against us from time to time in the ordinary course of business.&#160; These actions are in various preliminary
stages, and no judgments or decisions have been rendered by hearing boards or
courts.&#160; Management, after</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-26</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-26',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">reviewing developments to
date with legal counsel, is of the opinion that the outcome of such matters
will not have a material adverse effect on our consolidated financial position,
consolidated results of operations or consolidated cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Operating Leases</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have entered into
operating leases for certain property and equipment under terms ranging from
three to ten years.&#160; The rent expense
under these leases, as well as certain leases under month-to-month arrangements
for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001 was approximately
$4.6 million, $5.1 million and $5.7 million, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Future minimum payments
under the leases are as follows (in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="71%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:22.3pt;width:71.18%;">

  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At December&nbsp;31, 2003
and 2002, we had an outstanding letter of credit of $0.98 million and $1.06
million, respectively, under our revolving credit facility.&#160; The letter of credit acts as a guarantee of
lease payments for the property occupied by WTTA-TV in Tampa, FL pursuant to
the terms and conditions of the lease agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Affiliation Agreements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sixty of the 62
television stations that we own and operate or to which we provide programming
services or sales services, currently operate as affiliates of FOX (20
stations), WB (19 stations), ABC (8 stations), NBC (4 stations), UPN (6
stations) and CBS (3 stations).&#160; The
remaining two stations are independent.&#160;
The networks produce and distribute programming in exchange for each
station&#146;s commitment to air the programming at specified times and for
commercial announcement time during the programming.&#160; In addition, networks other than FOX generally pay each station
an affiliation agreement fee for each network-sponsored program broadcast by
the station, or fees for entering into the affiliation agreement.&#160; In some markets, we pay certain fees if we
have certain ratings successes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The affiliation
agreements of three ABC stations (WEAR-TV in Pensacola, Florida, WCHS-TV in
Charleston, West Virginia, and WXLV-TV in Greensboro/Winston-Salem, North
Carolina) have expired.&#160; We continue to
operate these stations as ABC affiliates and we do not believe ABC has any
current plans to terminate the affiliation agreements with any of these
stations.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2003,
the corresponding net book values for the affiliation agreements are $3.9
million, $2.6 million, and $12.4 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following affiliate
agreements are scheduled to expire during 2004.&#160; The ABC affiliate agreements with WLOS-TV and WSYX-TV, are
scheduled to expire on September&nbsp;8, 2004.&#160;
The UPN affiliate agreements with WABM-TV, WMMP-TV, WCGV-TV, WUXP-TV,
and WRDC-TV are scheduled to expire on July, 31, 2004.&#160; The UPN affiliate agreement with WUPN-TV is
scheduled to expire in June&nbsp;2004. The CBS affiliate agreements with
KGAN-TV and WGME-TV are scheduled to expire on December&nbsp;31, 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The NBC affiliation
agreements with WICS/WICD (Champaign/Springfield, Illinois) and WKEF-TV
(Dayton, Ohio) were scheduled to expire on April&nbsp;1, 2004.&#160; On February 25, 2004, NBC informed us that
they intend to terminate our affiliations with WKEF-TV (Dayton, Ohio) and
WICS/WICD (Champaign/Springfield, Illinois) effective on or about September
2004 and September 2005, respectively, in order to affiliate with another
station in each of those markets.&#160; We
are currently engaged in discussions with the ABC Television Network regarding
affiliating with ABC in these two markets since the stations which are
scheduled to acquire the NBC affiliations in Dayton and Champaign/Springfield
are currently ABC affiliates and will be giving up that affiliation in order to
become NBC affiliates. As of December 31, 2003 the corresponding net book
values of the affiliation agreements are $14.5 million and $10.3 million,
respectively. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The non-renewal or
termination of one or more of these or any of our other network affiliation
agreements would result in us no longer being able to carry programming of the
relevant network. This loss of programming would require us to obtain
replacement programming, which may involve higher costs and which may not be as
attractive to our target audiences, resulting in reduced revenues.&#160; Upon the termination of any of the above
affiliation agreements, we would be required to establish new affiliations with
other networks or operate as an independent.&#160;
At such time, the remaining value of the network affiliation asset could
become impaired and we would be required to write down the value of the asset.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-27</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-27',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Local Marketing Agreements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain of our stations
have entered into what have commonly been referred to as local marketing
agreements or LMAs.&#160; One typical type of
LMA is a programming agreement between two separately owned television stations
serving the same market, whereby the licensee of one station programs substantial
portions of the broadcast day and sells advertising time during such program
segments on the other licensee&#146;s station subject to the ultimate editorial and
other controls being exercised by the latter licensee.&#160; We believe these arrangements allow us to
reduce our operating expenses and enhance profitability.&#160; Although under the new FCC ownership rules
we would be allowed to continue to program most of the stations with which we
have an LMA, in the absence of a waiver, the new rules would require us to
terminate or modify three of our LMAs in markets where both the stations we own
and the station with which we have an LMA are ranked among the top four
stations in their particular DMA.&#160; The
FCC&#146;s new ownership rules include specific provisions permitting waivers of
this &#147;top four restriction.&#148;&#160; Although
there can be no assurances, we have studied the application of the new rules to
our markets and believe we are qualified for waivers.&#160; We believe an issue exists regarding whether the FCC has any
current legal right to enforce any rules prohibiting the acquisition of
television stations because the new rules have been stayed and the FCC
concluded the old rules could not be justified as necessary to the public
interest.&#160; The Third Circuit Court of
Appeals has stayed the application of the new rules as a result of numerous
legal challenges, including one filed by Sinclair.&#160; Oral argument regarding the legality of the new rules was held on
February&nbsp;11, 2004 and a decision is currently pending.&#160;&#160; During the pendency of the review, the
Third Circuit has ordered the FCC to continue to apply the existing ownership
rules.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On November&nbsp;15,
1999, we entered into five separate plans and agreements of merger, pursuant to
which we would acquire through merger with subsidiaries of Cunningham,
television broadcast stations WABM-TV, Birmingham, Alabama, KRRT-TV, San
Antonio, Texas, WVTV-TV, Milwaukee, Wisconsin, WRDC-TV, Raleigh, North Carolina
and WBSC-TV (formerly WFBC-TV), Anderson, South Carolina.&#160; The consideration for these mergers was the
issuance to Cunningham, of shares of our Class A Common voting stock.&#160; In December&nbsp;2001, we received FCC
approval on all the transactions except WBSC-TV.&#160; Accordingly, on February&nbsp;1, 2002, we closed on the purchase
of the FCC license and related assets of WABM-TV, KRRT-TV, WVTV-TV, and
WRDC-TV.&#160; The total value of the shares
issued in consideration for the approved mergers was $7.7 million.&#160; We have filed a petition for reconsideration
with the FCC to reconsider its denial of the acquisition of WBSC-TV and
recently amended our application to acquire the license in light of the FCC&#146;s
new multiple ownership rules adopted in June&nbsp;2003.&#160; However, the new rules have been stayed by
the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit, pending its review of the
rules.&#160; We also filed applications in
November&nbsp;2003 to acquire the license assets of the remaining five
Cunningham stations, WRGT-TV, Dayton, Ohio, WTAT-TV, Charleston, South
Carolina, WVAH-TV, Charleston, West Virginia, WNUV-TV, Baltimore, Maryland, and
WTTE-TV, Columbus, Ohio.&#160; These
applications are pending and may also be impacted by the existence of the stay
of the FCC&#146;s new multiple ownership rules.&#160;
The Rainbow/PUSH Coalition has filed a petition to deny these five
applications and to revoke all of Sinclair&#146;s licenses.&#160; We believe the petition is without merit
and, as with past petitions filed by Rainbow/PUSH, will not result in the
revocation of any of Sinclair&#146;s licenses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If we are required to
terminate or modify our LMAs, our business could be affected in the following
ways:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Losses on
investments</font></i>.&#160; As part of our
LMA arrangements, we own the non-license assets used by the stations with which
we have LMAs.&#160; If certain of these LMA
arrangements are no longer permitted, we would be forced to sell these assets,
restructure our agreements or find another use for them.&#160; If LMAs are prohibited, the market for such
assets may not be as good as when we purchased them and we would need to sell
the assets to the owner or purchaser of the related license assets.&#160; Therefore, we cannot be certain we will
recoup our investments.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Termination
penalties</font></i>.&#160; If the FCC
requires us to modify or terminate existing LMAs before the terms of the LMAs
expire, or under certain circumstances, we elect not to extend the term of the
LMAs, we may be forced to pay termination penalties under the terms of some of
our LMAs.&#160; Any such termination penalty
could be material.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">WNAB Options</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have entered into an
agreement with a third party to purchase certain license and non-license
television broadcast assets of WNAB-TV at our option (the call option) and
additionally, the third party may require us to purchase these license and
non-license broadcast assets at the option of the third party (the put
option).&#160; On January&nbsp;2, 2003, we
made an $18.0 million non-refundable deposit against the purchase price of the
put or call option on the non-license assets in return for a reduction of $0.1
million in our profit sharing arrangements.&#160;
Under current law, we have no right to buy WNAB-TV.&#160; If or when the put option becomes
exercisable, and if the current law has not changed, we may assign our option
to an eligible buyer.&#160; There can be no
assurance that we will find an eligible buyer or recover our commitment.&#160; Upon exercise, we may settle the call or put
options entirely in cash, or at our option, we may pay one-half of the purchase
price by issuing additional shares of our Class A common stock.&#160; The call and put option exercise prices vary
depending on the exercise dates and have been adjusted</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-28</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-28',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">for the deposit.&#160; The license asset call option exercise price
is $5.0 million prior to March&nbsp;31, 2005, $5.6 million from March&nbsp;31,
2005 until March&nbsp;31, 2006 and $6.2 million after March&nbsp;31, 2006.&#160; The non-license asset call option exercise
price is $8.3 million prior to March&nbsp;31, 2005, $12.6 million from
March&nbsp;31, 2005 to March&nbsp;31, 2006, and $16.0 million after
March&nbsp;31, 2006.&#160; The license asset
put option price is $5.4 million from July&nbsp;1, 2005 to July&nbsp;31, 2005,
$5.9 million from July&nbsp;1, 2006 to July&nbsp;31, 2006 and $6.3 million from
July&nbsp;1, 2007 to July&nbsp;31, 2007.&#160;
The non-license asset put option price is $7.9 million from July&nbsp;1,
2005 to July&nbsp;31, 2005, $12.4 million from July&nbsp;1, 2006 to
July&nbsp;31, 2006 and $16.0 million from July&nbsp;1, 2007 to July&nbsp;31,
2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">10.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>RELATED
PARTY TRANSACTIONS:</u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

payable to affiliates consisted of the following as of December&nbsp;31, 2003
and 2002</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes and capital leases
payable to affiliates as of December&nbsp;31, 2003 mature as follows (in
thousands):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="78%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:78.4%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="72%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:72.6%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2004</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.66%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="21%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:21.82%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6,737</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="72%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:72.6%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2005</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="23%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:23.5%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7,661</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="72%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:72.6%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2006</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="23%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:23.5%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5,303</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="72%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:72.6%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2007</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="23%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:23.5%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4,512</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="72%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:72.6%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2008</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="23%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:23.5%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3,939</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="72%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:72.6%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2009
  and thereafter</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="23%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:23.5%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19,916</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="72%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:72.6%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total
  minimum payments due</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="23%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:23.5%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">48,068</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="72%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:72.6%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Less:
  Amount representing interest</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="23%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:23.5%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(19,131</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="72%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:72.6%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.66%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="21%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:21.84%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28,937</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.38%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 1993, we loaned Gerstell Development Limited Partnership (a
partnership owned by class B Shareholders) $2.1 million.&#160; The note bears interest at 6.18%, with
principal payments beginning on November&nbsp;1, 1994, and had a final maturity
date of October&nbsp;1, 2013. As of December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002, the
balance outstanding was approximately $1.4 million and $1.5 million,
respectively.&#160; The note was paid in full
in February 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On September&nbsp;30,
1990, we issued certain notes (the founders&#146; notes) maturing on May 31, 2005,
payable to the late Julian S. Smith and Carolyn C. Smith, former majority
owners of Sinclair and the parents of class B shareholders.&#160; The founders&#146; notes, which were issued in
consideration for stock redemptions equal to 72.65% of the then outstanding
stock of Sinclair, have principal amounts of $7.5 million and $6.7 million,
respectively.&#160; The founders&#146; notes
include stated interest rates of 8.75%, which were payable annually from
October&nbsp;1990 until October&nbsp;1992, then payable monthly commencing
April&nbsp;1993 to December&nbsp;1996, and then semi-annually thereafter until
maturity. The effective interest rate approximates 9.4%. The founders&#146; notes
are secured by security interests in substantially all of Sinclair&#146;s assets and
subsidiaries, and are personally guaranteed by class B shareholders.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Principal and interest
payments on the founders&#146; notes is payable, in various amounts, each
April&nbsp;and October, beginning October&nbsp;1991 until October&nbsp;2005,
with a balloon payment due at maturity in the amount of $1.5 million.&#160; Principal and interest paid on the founders&#146;
note was $1.5 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003, $1.6 million
for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2002, and $1.7 million for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2001. At December&nbsp;31, 2003, $3.1 million of this
founders&#146; note remained outstanding.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-29</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-29',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Concurrently with our
initial public offering, we acquired options from certain shareholders of
Cunningham that will grant us the right to acquire, subject to applicable FCC
rules and regulations, 100% of the capital stock of Cunningham.&#160; The Cunningham option exercise price is
based on a formula that provides a 10% annual return to Cunningham. Cunningham
is the owner-operator and FCC licensee of WNUV-TV, Baltimore, Maryland,
WRGT-TV, Dayton, Ohio, WVAH, Charleston, West Virginia, WTAT-TV, Charleston,
South Carolina, WBSC-TV, Anderson, South Carolina and WTTE-TV, Columbus, Ohio.&#160; We have entered into five-year LMA
agreements (with five-year renewal terms at our option) with Cunningham
pursuant to which we provide programming to Cunningham for airing on WNUV-TV,
WRGT-TV, WVAH-TV, WTAT-TV, WBSC-TV and WTTE-TV.&#160; During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001, we
made payments of $4.7 million, $4.0 million and $11.8 million, respectively, to
Cunningham under these LMA agreements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In connection with our
sale of WCWB in Pittsburgh to WPTT, Inc., WPTT, Inc. issued to us a 15-year
senior secured term note of $6.0 million (the WPTT Note).&#160; We subsequently sold the WPTT Note to the
late Julian S. Smith and Carolyn C. Smith, the parents of the controlling
shareholders and both former shareholders of Sinclair, in exchange for the
payment of $50,000 and the issuance of a $6.6 million note receivable, which
bears interest at 7.21% per annum.&#160;
During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2001, we received $0.5 million
in interest payments on this note.&#160; At
December&nbsp;31, 2001, the balance on this note was $6.6 million.&#160; We acquired the assets of WCWB-TV and the
note was paid in full on January&nbsp;7, 2002.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the years ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001, we from time to time entered into
charter arrangements to lease aircraft owned by certain Class B
Shareholders.&#160; During the years ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001, we incurred expenses of approximately
$0.2 million, $0.2 million and $41,000 related to these arrangements,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain assets used by us
and our operating subsidiaries are leased from Cunningham Communications Inc.,
Keyser Investment Group, Gerstell Development Limited Partnership, and Beaver
Dam, LLC (entities owned by the Class B Shareholders).&#160; Lease payments made to these entities were
$4.1 million, $3.6 million, and $3.1 million for the years ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January&nbsp;1999, we
entered into a Local Marketing Agreement with Bay Television, Inc., which owns
the television station WTTA-TV in Tampa, FL.&#160;
The controlling stockholders own a substantial portion of the equity of
Bay Television, Inc.&#160; The Local
Marketing Agreement provides that we deliver television programming to Bay
Television, Inc., which broadcasts the programming in return for a monthly fee
to Bay Television, Inc. of $143,500.&#160; We
must also make an annual payment equal to 50% of the annual broadcast cash
flow, as defined in the Local Marketing Agreement, of the station, which is in
excess of $1.7 million.&#160; The additional
payment is reduced by 50% of the broadcast cash flow, as defined in the Local
Marketing Agreement that was below zero in prior calendar years.&#160; During 2003, we made payments of
approximately $1.7 million related to the Local Marketing Agreement.&#160; No payment was made in 2003 related to the
broadcast cash flow that exceeded $1.7 million for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003 as it was offset by the negative broadcast cash flow of
prior years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;30,
2002, we invested $20 million in Summa Holdings, Ltd. (Summa), resulting in a
17.5% equity interest.&#160; Summa is a
holding company, which owns automobile dealerships and a leasing company.&#160; David D. Smith, our President and Chief
Executive Officer, has a controlling interest in Summa and is a member of the
Board of Directors.&#160; We have significant
influence by holding a board seat (in addition to the board seat held
personally by David D. Smith); therefore, we account for this investment under
the equity method of accounting.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We sold advertising time
to Summa on WBFF-TV and WNUV-TV and received payments totaling $0.4 million,
$0.3 million and $0.2 million during the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31,
2003, 2002 and 2001, respectively.&#160; We
purchased a total of $0.2 million in vehicles and related vehicle services from
Summa during the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2003.&#160; Summa leases certain dealership properties
from a partnership in which David D. Smith has a 50% ownership interest.&#160; Summa made lease payments to this
partnership of $6.3 million, $4.9 million, and $4.6 million for the years ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001, respectively.&#160;&#160; Aggregate future minimum lease payments due to the partnership
are $50.0 million through 2013.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In August&nbsp;1999,
Allegiance Capital Limited Partnership (Allegiance), with the controlling
shareholders, our Chief Financial Officer and Executive Vice President and
Allegiance Capital Management Corporation (ACMC), the general partner,
established a small business investment company. ACMC, as the general partner,
controls all decision making, investing, and management of operations in
exchange for a monthly management fee based on actual expenses incurred which
currently averages approximately $35,600 paid by the limited partners. We,
along with the other limited partners, have committed to investing up to a
combined total of $15.0 million of which $7.5 million was invested as of
December&nbsp;31, 2003.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-30</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-30',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">11.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>ACQUISITIONS AND
DISPOSITIONS:</u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">WNYO Acquisition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In August&nbsp;2000, we
entered into an agreement to purchase the stock of Grant Television, Inc., the owner
of WNYO-TV in Buffalo, New York, for a purchase price of $51.5 million.&#160; In October&nbsp;2000, we completed the stock
acquisition of Grant, obtaining the non-license assets of WNYO-TV and began
programming the television station under local marketing agreement.&#160; The acquisition was accounted for under the
purchase method of accounting whereby the purchase price was allocated to
property and programming assets, definite-lived intangible broadcast assets and
other intangible assets for $2.9 million, $3.9 million and $39.8 million,
respectively.&#160; In December&nbsp;2001, we
received FCC approval and on January&nbsp;25, 2002, we completed the purchase
of the FCC license and related assets of WNYO-TV for a purchase price of $6.7
million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Cunningham/WPTT, Inc. Acquisition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On November&nbsp;15,
1999, we entered into an agreement to purchase substantially all of the assets
of television stations WCWB-TV, Channel 22, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, from the
owner of that television station, WPTT, Inc. In December&nbsp;2001, we received
FCC approval and on January&nbsp;7, 2002, we closed on the purchase of the FCC
license and related assets of WCWB-TV for a purchase price of $18.8 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On November&nbsp;15,
1999, we entered into five separate plans and agreements of merger, pursuant to
which it would acquire through merger with subsidiaries of Cunningham,
television broadcast stations WABM-TV, Birmingham, Alabama, KRRT-TV, San
Antonio, Texas, WVTV-TV, Milwaukee, Wisconsin, WRDC-TV, Raleigh, North
Carolina, and WBSC-TV (formerly WFBC-TV), Anderson, South Carolina.&#160; The consideration for these mergers is the
issuance to Cunningham of shares of our Class A Common voting Stock.&#160; In December&nbsp;2001, we received FCC
approval on all the transactions except for WBSC-TV.&#160; Accordingly, on February&nbsp;1, 2002, we closed on the purchase
of the FCC license and related assets of WABM-TV, KRRT-TV, WVTV-TV and
WRDC-TV.&#160; The total value of the shares
issued in consideration for the approved mergers was $7.7 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Mission Acquisition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to our merger
with Sullivan Broadcast Holdings, Inc. which was effective July&nbsp;1, 1998,
we acquired options to acquire television broadcast station WUXP-TV in
Nashville, Tennessee from Mission Broadcasting I, Inc. and television broadcast
station WUPN-TV in Greensboro, North Carolina from Mission Broadcasting II,
Inc.&#160; On November&nbsp;15, 1999, we
exercised our option to acquire both of the foregoing stations.&#160; In December&nbsp;2001, we received FCC
approval and in January&nbsp;2002, we closed on the purchase of the FCC
licenses and related assets of WUXP-TV and WUPN-TV for the assumption of notes
payable aggregating $4.2 million and $0.1 million of cash.&#160; Prior to closing, we programmed these
stations pursuant to an LMA.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Sullivan Acquisition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2001, we
received FCC approval to acquire 100% of the stock of Sullivan Broadcasting
Company II, Inc. and Sullivan Broadcasting Company IV, Inc. which, in the
aggregate, own the FCC license and related assets of six television
stations.&#160; In January&nbsp;2002, we
completed the purchase of the FCC license and related assets of WZTV-TV,
WUTV-TV, WXLV-TV, WRLH-TV, WMSN-TV and KOKH-TV.&#160; Prior to closing, we programmed these stations pursuant to
LMA&#146;s.&#160; As consideration for the purchase
of the FCC license and related assets of KOKH, we forgave a note receivable to
Sullivan IV in the amount of $16.6 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">WUHF Acquisition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;1999, we
entered into a stock purchase agreement with BS&amp;L Broadcasting, Inc.
(BS&amp;L) and its sole shareholder to acquire the stock of BS&amp;L, the
licensee of WUHF-TV, Rochester, New York. BS&amp;L acquired the license of
WUHF-TV from Sullivan II. One of the conditions to our acquisition of the stock
of BS&amp;L was the receipt of FCC approval.&#160;
On April&nbsp;30, 2002, we acquired the stock of BS&amp;L Broadcasting,
Inc. (BS&amp;L), from its sole shareholder, which owned the FCC license and
related assets of WUHF-TV in Rochester, New York.&#160; As consideration for the purchase of the FCC license and related
assets, we forgave a note receivable from BS&amp;L in the amount of $8.4
million.&#160; Prior to the completion of the
acquisition, we programmed WUHF-TV pursuant to a local marketing agreement.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-31</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-31',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">12.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>DISCONTINUED
OPERATIONS:</u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;18, 2002,
we entered into an agreement to sell the television station of WTTV-TV in
Bloomington, Indiana and its satellite station, WTTK-TV in Kokomo, Indiana to a
third party.&#160; On July&nbsp;24, 2002,
WTTV-TV had net assets and liabilities held for sale of $108.8 million, and we
completed such sale for $124.5 million and recognized a gain, net of taxes, of
$7.5 million, which was used to pay down indebtedness.&#160; As a result of adopting SFAS No. 144, we
reported the results of operations of WTTV-TV as discontinued operations in the
accompanying statements of operations.&#160;
Discontinued operations have not been segregated in the Statement of
Consolidated Cash Flows and, therefore, amounts for certain captions will not
agree with the accompanying consolidated statements of operations.&#160; The operating results of WTTV-TV are not
included in our consolidated results from continuing operations for the years
ended December&nbsp;31, 2002 and 2001.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Accounts receivable
related to discontinued operations, which we will continue to own the rights to
and collect, is included in accounts receivable, net of allowance for doubtful
accounts, in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets for all periods
presented.&#160; Such amounts were $187,628
(net of allowance of $168,105) and $220,667 (net of allowance of $144,253) as
of December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002, respectively.&#160; Net income from discontinued operations includes net broadcast
revenues of $10.2 million and $21.0 million for the years ended
December&nbsp;31, 2002 and 2001, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2003, we reduced
our income tax liability by $1.6 million as a result of the expiration of
certain statutes of limitations related to the sale of radio stations in prior
years.&#160; This adjustment was recorded in
discontinued operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">13.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>RESTRUCTURING
CHARGES:</u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
February&nbsp;2001, we offered a voluntary early retirement program to our
eligible employees and implemented a restructuring program to reduce operating
and overhead costs.&#160; As a result, we
reduced our staff by 186 employees and incurred a restructuring charge of $2.3
million, which is included in the accompanying Consolidated Statements of
Operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
September&nbsp;2001, KDNL-TV in St. Louis, Missouri discontinued programming
its local news broadcast.&#160; As a result,
we incurred a restructuring charge of $1.1 million.&#160; During December&nbsp;2001, WXLV-TV in Winston-Salem, North
Carolina discontinued programming its local news broadcast.&#160; As a result we incurred a restructuring
charge of $0.3 million.&#160; The
restructuring charges are related to severance and operating contract
termination costs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table
provides a roll-forward of liabilities resulting from these restructuring
charges (in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.54%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.78%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:.94%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">14.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>CONTRACT TERMINATION
COSTS:</u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2001, we
terminated certain agreements and entered into new agreements with unrelated
third parties. We incurred $5.1 million of contract termination costs, and
received $21.4 million for entering into a new contract. Both amounts will be
recognized as a reduction in selling, general and administrative expense on a
straight-line basis over the term of the contracts.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">15.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>EMPLOYEE BENEFIT
PLAN:</u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Sinclair Broadcast
Group, Inc. 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan and Trust (the SBG Plan) covers our
eligible employees.&#160; Contributions made
to the SBG Plan include an employee elected salary reduction amount,
company-matching contributions and a discretionary amount determined each year
by the Board of Directors.&#160; Our 401(k)
expense for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001 was $1.4
million, $1.3 million and $1.2 million, respectively.&#160; There were no discretionary contributions during these
periods.&#160; During December&nbsp;1997, we
registered 800,000 shares of our Class A</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-32</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-32',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Common Stock with the SEC
to be issued as a matching contribution for the 1997 plan year and subsequent
plan years.&#160; During February&nbsp;2003,
we registered an additional 800,000 shares of our Class A Common Stock with the
SEC to be issued as matching contributions for subsequent plan years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">16.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>STOCK-BASED
COMPENSATION PLANS:</u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Stock Option Plans</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Designated Participants Stock Option Plan.</font></i>&#160; In connection with our initial public
offering in June&nbsp;1995 (IPO), our Board of Directors adopted an Incentive
Stock Option Plan (ISOP) for Designated Participants (Designated Participants
Stock Option Plan) pursuant to which options for shares of Class A common stock
were granted to certain of our key employees.&#160;
The Designated Participants Stock Option Plan provides that the number
of shares of Class A Common Stock reserved for issuance under the Designated
Participant Stock Option Plan is 136,000.&#160;
Options granted pursuant to the Designated Participants Stock Option
Plan must be exercised within 10 years following the grant date.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2003, 34,500 shares
were available for future grants.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Long-Term Incentive Plan. </font></i>&#160;In June&nbsp;1996, our Board of Directors
adopted, upon approval of the shareholders by proxy, the 1996 Long-Term
Incentive Plan (LTIP).&#160; The purpose of
the LTIP is to reward key individuals for making major contributions to our
success and that of our subsidiaries and to attract and retain the services of
qualified and capable employees.&#160;
Options granted pursuant to the LTIP must be exercised within 10 years
following the grant date.&#160; A total of
14,000,000 shares of Class A Common Stock are reserved for awards under the
plan.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2003,
12,394,305 shares have been granted under the LTIP and 7,075,189 shares
(including forfeited shares) were available for future grants.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Incentive Stock Option Plan. </font></i>&#160;In June&nbsp;1996, the Board of Directors
adopted, upon approval of the shareholders by proxy, an amendment to our
Incentive Stock Option Plan.&#160; The
purpose of the amendment was (i) to increase the number of shares of Class A
Common Stock approved for issuance under the plan from 800,000 to 1,000,000,
(ii) to lengthen the period after date of grant before options become
exercisable from two years to three years and (iii) to provide immediate
termination and three-year ratable vesting of options in certain
circumstances.&#160; Options granted pursuant
to the ISOP must be exercised within 10 years following the grant date.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2003, 714,200 shares
have been granted under the ISOP and 801,334 shares (including forfeited
shares) were available for future grants.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A summary of changes in
outstanding stock options is as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-33</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">241</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="57%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:57.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Weighted-average
  number of common equivalent shares outstanding</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">85,793</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">85,580</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">84,624</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basic earnings per share
(EPS) is calculated using the weighted average number of shares outstanding
during the period.&#160; Diluted earnings per
share (Diluted EPS) includes the potentially dilutive effect, if any, which
would occur if outstanding options to purchase common stock were exercised
using the treasury stock method.&#160; Stock
options to purchase 0.2 million and 0.3 million incremental shares of common
stock were outstanding during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2002 and
December&nbsp;31, 2001, respectively, but were not included in the computation
of diluted EPS as the effect would be anti-dilutive. Stock options to purchase
shares of common stock were outstanding during the years ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001, but were not included in the computation
of diluted EPS because the option&#146;s exercise price was greater than the average
market price of the common shares.&#160;
Common shares that would be issued upon conversion of our convertible
notes are not included in the computation of diluted EPS because the conversion
price was greater than the average market price of the common shares.&#160; Common shares that would be issued upon
conversion of our preferred stock were not included in the computation of
diluted EPS because the effect would be anti-dilutive.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-34</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-34',FILE='C:\jms\mvangb\04-2752-1\task82816\2752-1-ba.htm',USER='mvangb',CD='Feb 27 14:48 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><u><font style="font-weight:bold;">CONDENSED CONSOLIDATING FINANCIAL
STATEMENTS:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sinclair Television
Group, Inc. (STG) is a 100% owned subsidiary of Sinclair Broadcast Group, Inc.
created in 2003.&#160; On September&nbsp;30,
2003, we completed the creation of a modified holding company structure,
whereby we transferred substantially all of our television broadcast assets and
liabilities to STG. As such, STG has become the primary obligor under our
existing bank credit agreement, the 8.75% Senior Subordinated Notes due 2011
and the 8% Senior Subordinated Notes due 2012.&#160;
Our class A Common Stock, class B Common Stock, Series D Convertible
Exchangeable Preferred Stock, and the 4.875% Convertible Senior Subordinated
Notes remain at Sinclair Broadcast Group, Inc. and are not obligations or
securities of STG.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sinclair Broadcast Group,
Inc. has fully and unconditionally guaranteed all of STG&#146;s obligations and
those guarantees are joint and several.&#160;
KDSM, LLC is a 100% owned subsidiary of Sinclair Broadcast Group, Inc.
and has fully and unconditionally guaranteed all of STG&#146;s obligations and those
guarantees are joint and several. Neither Sinclair Broadcast Group, Inc. nor
the guarantors have any significant restrictions on their ability to obtain
funds from their subsidiaries in the form of dividends or loans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Although STG was created
on September&nbsp;30, 2003, we have presented balance sheets, statements of
operations and cash flows as if STG was in existence in prior periods.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following condensed
consolidating financial statements present the results of operations, financial
position and cash flows of Sinclair Broadcast Group, Inc., STG, KDSM LLC, the
direct and indirect non-guarantor subsidiaries of Sinclair Broadcast Group,
Inc. and the eliminations necessary to arrive at our information on a
consolidated basis.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-35</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>
